cicd pipeline is if if something goes wrong with your code a test fails or um

and you've been asked to change that to Bing now typically you might create a branch and in that Branch the first
thing you do is you rename this file and rename all the references to it and then you start going through the
implementation and change changing it so it uses the Bing service instead right
instead what you could do is create a branch um and in that the first thing
you do is you abstract away you have an interface and then you use dependency injection or inversion of control
techniques so that when somebody asks for an ieather provider it says oh the one we're using is the Google weather
provider here is the implementation then you merge that Branch into your main um branch and
deploy it to production now functionally nothing has changed right your tests are
going to check whether you've done this correctly or not but everything's in your main branch now and functionally
nothing has changed you've got exactly the same code but what this allows you to do is just start implementing another
one you can just start implementing a Bing weather provider and if you get halfway through
as long as it compiles you can still deploy the production because this code doesn't get called it's dead code
you could even get it to a point where you think it's probably about right and then attach a feature flag to it and ask
